name: MyHealthNotes
0:
”Alexa open My Health Notes”
”Alexa tell My Health Notes I have a new symptom”
”Alexa ask My Health Notes to send me a report”
skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: my health notes
Developer Terms of Use
des:
My Health Notes keeps track of your personal health observations. Use it for your own records, or to help prepare for health consultations.

When you notice a new or changed symptom, or any health concern, you can say "Add Entry", then give a short description.

The skill time-stamps and remembers all your entries for up to 30 days.

Later, you can say "Send Report" to receive your health notes by email.

The email report serves as a permanent record of everything you've noticed and logged during the past few weeks.

Having your notes in one place ensures you won't forget to mention something important if you later visit a health professional, or just discuss your health with family and friends. As it's just a text email, you can you can edit it if necessary before sharing it with others.

What you can say:

 Add a Note - add a short health-related note or other observation (e.g. "I have a stiff neck this morning")

 Insert a note from a previous day - this variant lets you add symptoms you forgot to add earlier. 

 List my Notes - list just your most recent entries (for the full list, see Send Report) 

 Send Report - sends an email listing all your entries going back 30 days. The email goes to the email address associated with your Amazon account.

You don't have to be exact in what you say - just try saying what you might say to a friend. The skill understands many phrases like "I have a new symptom to add".

Permissions:

To get the most out of My Health Notes, you must grant the skill permission to access your email address and first name*. You can do this in the Alexa app when first enabling the skill, or later when prompted by the skill. Once you have granted permission, the skill requests your details each time you request a report, so it's always up to date. It never saves your details or uses them for any other purpose. 

You first name is used to personalise your report, which serves as a reminder and helps with email delivery.

Disclaimer:

This skill does not provide medical advice, and is for informational and educational purposes only, and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, treatment or diagnosis. Call your doctor to receive medical advice. If you think you may have a medical emergency, please dial your local emergency response phone number.
